titleStmt.title: A garden inclosed, and Wisdom justified only of her children. Being two exercises, discovering the glory, beauty and perfection of the love of God to saints that are so comprehended, and in such a glorious inclosure: and also the sweet reflections in, and from saints, in iustifying wisdom: which were delivered at New-port Pagnell, about a yeare and a half since: for declaration whereof, the authour was then imprisoned, and since accused, for delivering of blasphemie. by Paul Hobson.
titleStmt.author: Hobson, Paul.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iames and Ioseph Moxon, for Henry Overton, and are to be sold at his shop, in Popes-head Alley: and for Giles Calvert, at the spread Eagle, at the west end of Pauls,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the spread Eagle, at the west end of Pauls
